intro: Psychotria inundata, commonly known as the water psychotria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in rainforests. Psychotria inundata is also known for its use in traditional medicine and its role in ecological systems.
